text:
TULIO DE MELO: It's difficult
to see the wives and the kids.

And some kids, they
don't realize yet.

Even the wives,
they don't realize
yet what really happened.
They-- I mean, the kids--

they're waiting their
father to come back
from a long trip with the club.

And this is the difficult part
for me, to see the families.

We feel that, and
I'm pretty sure we're

going to play at home
in any game this season.

I mean, even the
clubs who's going

to play against
us, the supporters,
they will respect us.

And if they lose
against Chapecoense,
I think will be not so bad.
I mean, not to lose to any club.

Because, I mean, I
think Chapecoense now

is the second club
of every supporter
of football in the world.

The president and the
director, they choose
every player who is here now.

Many, many players was
offered to Chapecoense.

Thousand, I mean,
even some stars.

But they choose to pick the
good guys with the profile

of the club, to keep
doing the history

the same way it
was doing before.

So I think we will
keep the profile
and the soul of this club.
